intro: Wallisia cyanea, commonly known as the blue wallisia, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers, which bloom in clusters. Its leaves are ovate and hairy, often covered in fine white pubescence. Wallisia cyanea thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and salt spray.
